programme.desc: 'S30/E8 - Girl Meets Flay'. Molly Yeh leaves the farm to join Alex Guarnaschelli to bring down Bobby. They hope on chefs Sam Fore and Jon Keeley can dole out a loss to Bobby.

programme.desc: Guy Fieri samples incredible seafood this time, including an oyster shack in New Orleans and a family ran eatery that still uses their grandmother's cookbook in California.

programme.desc: 'S52/E11 - Seeking A Sous-Chef: Battle 3'. Four more chefs try to score the chance to work as a judge's sous-chef. Offal is an awfully shocking surprise, and a cut of meat proves problematic.

programme.desc: 'S1/E7 - Stacks Of Flavour'. Ching learns the secret to making Har Gau shrimp dumplings, and also samples some gigantic Cantonese vanilla sponge muffins.

programme.desc: 'S1/E8 - So The Chinese Left A Mark In Macau'. Ching meets Antonio Coelho who owns a Macau institution that serves up Portuguese food. He cooks Ching his signature seafood Cataplana.

programme.desc: 'S1/E9 - The Buzzing Capital Of Deliciousness'. Ching checks out Tskiji fish market, the biggest fish market in the world. She then heads to a popular sushi joint to get a sushi masterclass.

programme.title: Ching's Amazing Asia
programme.desc: 'S1/E10 - An Explosion of Flavours'. Ching discovers a Sichuan restaurant that's mad about spice, packing fiery heat and big flavours.

programme.title: Ching's Amazing Asia
programme.desc: 'S1/E1 - Golden Foodie Gems In Hong Kong'. Ching visits Kowloon to find some foodie gems. Cooking alongside local chefs she makes golden spring rolls and snow topped BBQ pork bao.

programme.title: Ching's Amazing Asia

programme.desc: 'S1/E3 - Part 3: Conquest And Collapse'. The Bronze Age had the first large urban centers, powerful kingdoms and armies, writing, and trade routes across vast areas. What led to the end of the Bronze Age?

programme.title: Traitor/Patriot

programme.desc: 'S1/E2 - 1941-1942'. In the East, Hitler launches Operation Barbarossa and invades the Soviet Union, reaching the outskirts of Moscow. But winter and Soviet resistance break his momentum.

programme.desc: 'S10/E11 of 16 - Beat The Unbeaten: A Cutlass Above'. For the first time in Forged in Fire history, two champions will return for the opportunity to go head to head against one of our titans of the forge.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: 'S24/E24 - The Rick-Sy Rebellion'. When a seller whips into the shop with an 'Energy Dome' hat made for the band DEVO, will Rick's offer top the charts? And later, Rick's intrigued by a signed George Washington letter.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: 'S24/E24 - The Rick-Sy Rebellion'. When a seller whips into the shop with an 'Energy Dome' hat made for the band DEVO, will Rick's offer top the charts? And later, Rick's intrigued by a signed George Washington letter.

programme.title: ALL THINGS MOTORING
programme.desc: 'S10/E2'. Season finale. Mike attends Alfa Romeo Rosso Track Day, and Ernest takes part in the CHD Tracktion drift racing event. This is a show with slides and smiles.

programme.title: The Bike Show
programme.desc: 'S25/E33'. This week on The Bike Show, is the new R 12 G/S BMW's newest off-road machine, Suzuki launches a new superbike, and we all get stuck in the mud.

programme.title: IGNITION Goes To SEMA
programme.desc: 'S1/E2'. In the second instalment, Vic feasts his eyes on a pimped Volkswagen Beetle, a restored and enhanced 1970s Toyota Corolla and a two-door Ford Sierra with modern mechanicals.

programme.title: The Guild Garage
programme.desc: 'S2/E11'. Janice rushes to finish her 1960 Land Rover project, Larry and Ron diagnose a 1948 Delahaye misfire, and Greg struggles reinstalling a serviced engine in a 1991 Alfa Romeo.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: 'S3/E23'. A cruise over the Alps to Italy in a Maserati GranCabrio MC. A Brit with a fiery temperament, the Jaguar XK-RS convertible with 550 hp. Mercedes AMG's SL models.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: 'S3/E24'. Luxury class grand tourers with four doors. Porsche introduced their Panamera as a Plugin Hybrid or equipped with new turbo engines. BMW responded with their M6 Gran Coupe.

programme.desc: 'S4/E11'. Derek picks up Swedish models, a Saab 96L and Volvo P1800ES. A British AC Aceca sports car comes up for sale and a pooch makes an audacious auction bid for an American hot dog van.

programme.desc: 'S25/E33'. The 1000 bonkers Chevrolet Corvette Z R1 gets an even bigger boost. We've also got a Ford pickup truck for late night street racers. It doubles as your daily workhorse.

programme.title: Barbie: A Touch Of Magic
programme.desc: 'S1/E11 - Lizard Lift-Off'. Peggy and Rocki go to a mysterious island so that Peggy can accomplish her mission. Barbie and Ken are in hot pursuit, with Trey and Skipper not far behind.

programme.title: Karma's World

programme.title: Grade 12 Life Sciences
programme.desc: 'S3/E22 - Human Evolution'. In this episode, we will be exploring evidence for our common ancestry with African apes.

programme.title: Grade 12 Life Sciences
programme.desc: 'S3/E21 - Speciation and Evolution in Present Times'. We learn how speciation takes place by focusing on some examples. We will look at mechanisms that keep species reproductively isolated or separate.

programme.title: Grade 12 Life Sciences
programme.desc: 'S3/E20 - Evolution by Natural Selection'. In this episode, we further explore Darwin's ideas, which led to the theory of natural selection as the mechanism that causes evolution.

programme.title: Grade 12 Life Sciences
programme.desc: 'S3/E19 - Ideas About Origins'. We explore ideas about origins. We are referring to the origins of life and how organisms have changed over time.

programme.title: Grade 12 Life Sciences
programme.desc: 'S3/E18 - Plants Responses to the Environment'. We examine plant responses to the environment. We will focus on some of the major plant hormones, namely auxin, gibberellin and abscisic acid.

programme.title: Grade 12 Life Sciences
programme.desc: 'S3/E17 - Homeostasis in Humans'. We look at what homeostasis is, negative feedback mechanisms and thermoregulation.

programme.title: Grade 2 Numeracy
programme.desc: 'S3/E18 - Number Bonds'. We learn to about number bonds.

programme.title: Grade 3 Numeracy
programme.desc: 'S3/E18 - Place Value To 700'. We learn about place value to 700

programme.title: Grade 4 Mathematics
programme.desc: 'S3/E18 - Measuring tools Episode 2'. We learn about measuring tools. This lesson has two episodes.

programme.title: Grade 5 Mathematics

programme.title: Grade 6 Mathematics
programme.desc: 'S3/E18 - Multiple operations'. We learn about multiple ways to solve problems.

programme.title: Grade 7 Mathematics
programme.desc: 'S3/E18 - Algebraic equations: Number sentences'. We learn about writing number sentences.

programme.title: Grade 9 Mathematics

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Herbal Symphony
programme.desc: Summer: Discover Japan's oldest private medicinal herb garden in Uda - the natural landscape from 300 years ago is preserved in a botanical time capsule as a sanctuary of local culture and history.

programme.title: The Beauty Of Japanese Swords
programme.desc: Admired since ancient times for their beauty, Japanese swords are amazing works of art - this time, a perfect distillation of craftsmanship: Gunchomon Hyogo-gusari no Tachi.

programme.title: Dining With The Chef
programme.desc: Traditional techniques and resourceful recipes as Chefs Saito and Rika present their unique approaches to cooking delicious Japanese food!

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Short Programme
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan presents a variety of short programmes focusing on Japan and Asia.

programme.title: Deeper Look
programme.desc: Experienced anchor Del Irani has a cutting-edge dialogue with a first-class guest on current affairs topics.

programme.title: Dig More Japan!
programme.desc: This show introduces NHK World's many attractive programmes in fun short videos - the clips will also be introduced on social media to meet the needs of people who are interested in Japan.

programme.title: Dining With The Chef
programme.desc: Learn about Japanese home cooking with Master Chef Saito, who cooks using traditional Japanese cooking techniques, in five minutes!

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: NHK World-Japan Special Programme
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan presents a wide range of programmes from news, current affairs, and documentaries focusing on Japan and Asia.

programme.title: Dive In Tokyo
programme.desc: Tokyo: a place where both tradition and the latest trends coexist. Join us on a journey to historic old towns and encounter many fun surprises along the way!

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: The World Heritage Sites In Japan
programme.desc: From natural landscapes to historic architecture representing centuries of cultural development, Japan's World Heritage sites offer a wide range of glimpses into history and the beauty of nature.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: An in-depth interview programme featuring professionals or experts in the world who share their unique insights, information and analysis.

programme.title: Japan's Top Inventions
programme.desc: Made in Japan! The fascinating stories and secrets hidden behind the creation of Japan's most loved and intriguing inventions.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: NHK World-Japan Special Programme
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan presents a wide range of programmes from news, current affairs, and documentaries focusing on Japan and Asia.

programme.title: One In Every Japanese
programme.desc: 1 in 1000 Japanese have experience as a lay judge in court cases - we witness a networking event for former lay judges where they discuss unique experiences. What does it feel like to judge others?

programme.title: Frontrunners
programme.desc: This show highlights professionals at the very forefront of their fields - we showcase their amazing work, discover their motivations, and learn about the challenges they face in the future.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Matsuri: The Heartbeat Of Japan
programme.desc: A week into the new year, giant torches are lit in a shrine precinct. The shadows they create enable a demon-oni-to go to a river and cleanse people of troubles. This is Oniyo: the night of the oni.

programme.title: Herbal Symphony
programme.desc: Discover Japan's oldest private medicinal herb garden in Uda - here the natural landscape from 300 years ago is preserved in a botanical time capsule as a sanctuary of local culture and history.

programme.title: Science View
programme.desc: Tiny nematodes can survive in harsh environments, regenerate damaged tissue, and make decisions - they're being studied for hints about new medicines as we also look at recycled concrete.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: NHK World-Japan Special Programme
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan presents a wide range of programmes from news, current affairs, and documentaries focusing on Japan and Asia.

programme.title: The Beauty Of Japanese Swords
programme.desc: Admired since ancient times for their beauty, Japanese swords are amazing works of art - this time, Yasutsuna (Onikirimaru), a blade that was used to defeat a terrible demon.

programme.title: Kabuki Kool
programme.desc: Chobei led a vigilante group to protect people from samurai abuses - actor Kataoka Ainosuke explores him in two plays, one showing a fateful encounter and one showing his tragic death.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Cinematic Journey
programme.desc: Join our explorers as they pursue the cinematic beauty of Japan - in this episode, Kyle Card hikes the newly-designated long trail around majestic Mount Fuji and discovers its secrets.

programme.title: Ramen Japan
programme.desc: Two local takes on ramen that kept Hiroshima fed during postwar reconstruction - these are flavours that have been passed down for generations.

programme.title: Dive In Tokyo
programme.desc: Tokyo: a place where both tradition and the latest trends coexist. Join us on a journey to historic old towns and encounter many fun surprises along the way!

programme.desc: NHK World-Japan presents a wide range of programmes from news, current affairs, and documentaries focusing on Japan and Asia.

programme.title: Passing The Torch Of Peace
programme.desc: A German playwright finds inspiration in a piano that survived the atomic bombing and its owner, who died after the blast at the age of 19, to create a piece warning against war's impact on the young.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: An in-depth interview programme featuring professionals or experts in the world who share their unique insights, information and analysis.

programme.title: The World Heritage Sites In Japan
programme.desc: From natural landscapes to historic architecture representing centuries of cultural development, Japan's World Heritage sites offer a wide range of glimpses into history and the beauty of nature.

programme.title: On The Wings
programme.desc: Join us on a night flight to admire Japan's stunning views on a journey from Tokyo to Fukuoka - behold the sublime beauty of Mount Fuji at sunset and the sparkling night views of major cities.
